title: Quiz 9: Analysis & Presentation
description: Test your ability to process, analyze, and present both qualitative and quantitative data.

questions.question: The process of organizing, summarizing, and visualizing quantitative data is referred to as ___BLANK___ statistics.
questions.explanation: Descriptive statistics (mean, mode, tables) describe the data.

questions.question: Which graphic method consists of bars with NO spaces between them and is used for continuous variables?
questions.explanation: Histograms show continuous data distribution; Bar charts show discrete categories (with spaces).

questions.question: Order the steps of Qualitative Data Analysis:
questions.explanation: Qualitative analysis moves from cleaning -> categorizing -> interpreting -> reporting.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid methods of data presentation? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Data must be organized into tables, charts, or graphs to be presented effectively.

questions.question: Match the table type to its description:

pairs.right: Explains a single line of characters/variables
Describes data by two or more components/variables
Empty table prepared during planning to visualize data
Shows how often a value occurs

questions.explanation: Simple=One variable; Compound=Multiple variables; Dummy=Planning tool.

questions.question: In qualitative research, data analysis and report writing often happen simultaneously (go hand in hand).
questions.explanation: True. Unlike quantitative research, qualitative analysis is an ongoing, iterative process during writing.

questions.question: What is the process of turning survey responses into standard categories or codes called?
questions.explanation: Coding is assigning values/categories to responses for analysis.

questions.question: Examine the Pie Chart description: 'It shows the top four outpatient cases in percentages.' What is a prerequisite for using a pie chart?

richContent.content: Pie charts show parts of a whole.

options.text: Data must be converted into percentages
Data must be raw numbers only

questions.explanation: Pie charts represent proportions totaling 100%, so data must be percentages.

questions.question: Which axis usually represents the 'Frequency' in a graph?
questions.explanation: Frequencies go on the vertical (Y) axis; scores/categories go on the horizontal (X) axis.

questions.question: A Dummy Table contains actual data collected from the field.
questions.explanation: False. A Dummy Table has empty cells; it is used for planning HOW to present data before collection.
